title: I flew to Nice on a private jet — here's what it's like compared to business class
text:
Flying in business class offers more space, better food, and overall comfort, but there's an even more luxurious option: flying in a private jet.

While the cost of traveling by private jet is quite substantial, the service offers a lot more privacy, and it's much more personable.

I flew from Warsaw to Nice aboard the NetJets Bombardier Challenger 350 to see how it compared with flying in business class.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

When it comes to airlines, the term "luxury" is often synonymous with business class or first-class travel.

There's ample space — at least compared with economy class — the food quality is a lot better, and you also have alcohol at your disposal. What more could you want?

Well, there is an even more luxurious option available to those willing to pay the right amount: flying on a private jet.

Though this can cost thousands of dollars even if it's within one area — Europe, for instance — passengers can travel knowing they can enjoy the same benefits that business class travelers, just with a little extra time, comfort, and privacy.

I flew from Warsaw to Nice aboard the NetJets Bombardier Challenger 350, which can carry up to nine passengers.

Here's how flying in a private jet stood up against taking a business class flight.
description: A flight in a private jet can cost thousands of dollars, but passengers get extra time, comfort, and privacy.
